In previous SARS outbreaks, patients with asthma, in particular children, appeared to be less susceptible to the coronavirus: the rate of asthma exacerbations described is low and prognosis good. 1, 8 In contrast, during influenza epidemics, asthma is involved in more severe cases, some needing mechanical ventilation, including patients of paediatric age.
9 The exact reasons for this remain unknown, but it has been confirmed during the current coronavirus pandemic with children having a better prognosis, although as likely as adults are to get infected with SARS-CoV-2.
10 Different ACE2 expression or maturation, innate immunity memory and a constitutional high lymphocyte count in children may be part of the explanation.
